DataElement.preferredName: PRO-CTCAE Telephone System Symptom Report During Study Use Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient used the PRO-CTCAE telephone system during the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PRO-CTCAE Telephone System Symptom Report During Study Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A library of items for patient self-reporting of symptoms and side effects associated with cancer treatment trials._Electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds._A group of independent but interrelated devices working together._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._A short textual account; having provided a short account._At some point in a given period of time._Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research._To put into action or service.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcomes Version of CTCAE Telephone Device Component System
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A library of items for patient self-reporting of symptoms and side effects associated with cancer treatment trials.:Electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds.:A group of independent but interrelated devices working together.

Concepts.longName: Patient Reported Outcomes Version of CTCAE
Concepts.definition: A library of items for patient self-reporting of symptoms and side effects associated with cancer treatment trials.
Electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds.
A group of independent but interrelated devices working together.

Property.preferredName: Symptom Report During Clinical Study Use
Property.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:At some point in a given period of time.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :To put into action or service.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
At some point in a given period of time.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
To put into action or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
